name: Toast

jtbd.functional: Provide non-blocking feedback about system actions (success, error, warning, info) that auto-dismisses without interrupting the user's workflow.
jtbd.affordance: Recognizable notification pattern — appears at screen edge, contains icon + message + optional dismiss action. Users immediately understand this is transient feedback.
jtbd.emotional: Confirms the system responded to their action. Reduces anxiety about whether an operation succeeded.

anatomy.container: .t-toast-container — Fixed position container at bottom-right, stacks toasts in reverse column order with gap spacing
anatomy.toast: .t-toast — Individual notification with slide-in animation (disabled under prefers-reduced-motion)
anatomy.title: .t-toast__title — Optional bold title line
anatomy.dismiss: .t-toast__dismiss — Close button with minimum 44px touch target

accessibility.keyboard: Dismiss button focusable with 44px touch target, auto-dismiss can be paused on hover/focus
accessibility.screenReader: Toast content announced automatically via aria-live region
accessibility.motionReduced: slide-in animation disabled when prefers-reduced-motion: reduce

knownIssues: No pause-on-hover behavior for auto-dismiss implemented in CSS
Multiple simultaneous toasts stack via column-reverse but have no max-count limit
ARIA attributes (role, aria-live, aria-label on dismiss) require JS implementation — CSS cannot enforce
futureConsiderations: Action button variant (e.g., Undo link inside toast)
Persistent toast variant that requires explicit dismiss
Configurable auto-dismiss timing per severity level
Icon color propagation per severity modifier
